edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.server.Models

Interface TwoPlayerGameModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TicTacToeModel

    public interface TwoPlayerGameModel
    Basic two player game interface which is to be used to store the main 3 functions that every two player game must implement in order to function properly.
    Version:
    for CS56, Spring 2013
    Author:
    Joseph Colicchio, Adam Ehrlich

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkWinner()
      Return whether a player has won the game in the current turn yet or not
      java.lang.String getState()
      Is responsible for getting information about the instance variables in the game using some form of string parser.
      void setState(java.lang.String state)
      Is responsible for updating the model as to what is going on.

    • Method Detail

      • checkWinner

        boolean checkWinner()
        Return whether a player has won the game in the current turn yet or not
        Returns:
        has someone won the game

      • setState

        void setState(java.lang.String state)
        Is responsible for updating the model as to what is going on. Usually it is a wise idea to pass in some string that is parsable by your setState() function to update the variables in the model.
        Parameters:
        state - the state of the game

      • getState

        java.lang.String getState()
        Is responsible for getting information about the instance variables in the game using some form of string parser. Similar to setState, but is meant to be handled by the Server Controller for the specified game.
        Returns:
        the current state of the instance variables for the game
